heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 31 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (186°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 4.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%) and rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.2 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 451.0m higher than yesterday, 108.3m higher than the past week, 40.9m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 696m to a maximum of 976m, averaging 1285.5m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1177.2m and 1244.6m respectively.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and near calm conditions. Showers, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and periods of sunshine are expected. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (5.1°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
